comments.commentBody:
For sanity's sake, can we get real? There is nothing wrong, nor illegal for another country, friend, or foe with a vested interest in the outcome of an election in another (especially in a large one, like the US) doing its best to exercise some influence and prepare for either eventuality.
Whether it is Russia, or China, or Germany, or France, South-Africa, Saudi Arabia, Iraq, Israel (especially Israel), it's the same, each and every time.
And the US does it too: like Obama did regarding Brexit, just before the vote in the UK.

Which IMHO is a grave insult to all.
The US has been doing the same since times immemorial and not always just watching from the sidelines, or 'communicating through their Ambassador' but in open armed intervention.
So why all this fuss?

There's a very simple proof that all this noise is just a latest invention. Hillary used all the dirt, all leaks, all the tools to hit Trump. She stopped at nothing and would have no problems with any attack on Trump. If there was ANYTHING in these current accusations - you think it wouldn't be poured onto Trump in the elections?
So not only is sessions a grand marshal of the Ku Klux Klan but he's also a Russian spy?

replies.commentBody: You've been programmed to be hungry for something, I wouldn't exactly call it the truth.

comments.commentBody: And what about Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov's admission in an interview with Interfax that during the campaign “there were contacts” with Trump's people, and “Obviously, we know most of the people from his entourage"? Godspeed to the investigators. We are hungry for, and our country's welfare depends on, the truth. ~
Why isn't this enough to impeach and lock the administration up?

These are the consequences of alternative facts, where a large swath of the population ceases to believe established truths, preferring instead to elect a border-line, unapologetic traitor to lead the country. Besides, I did not for once believe that Trump fairly won Pennsylvania, Michigan, Florida, and Wisconsin. From election night I always believed the Russians rigged the results.

The Trump administration so far has proven the be either incredibly inept or incredibly corrupt. Trump can clear the air once and for all by releasing his taxes. If not, bring on the special prosecutor. We've all been kept in the dark for long enough, and the American people deserve the truth.

I feel like this is the part of the Movie where the Cavalry is arriving!!!!

I'm old. But the Cavalry isn't!

As soon as Putin realizes the Trump Administration is so incompetent as to be useless to his aims, he will leak the fatal blow to Trump, which will still help his goal of destabilizing Western Democracies.
Need an independent counsel to investigate.

This reader gives thanks for a free and independent press. If president trump had  his way, the press would be muzzled to hide his connection to Russia. Mr. Sessions behavior raises very serious questions about the circumstance under which he was selected as attorney general.
And the sudden unexpected death of Ambassador Kislyak.  Is that suspicious or what!?

"..American intelligence began picking up conversations in which Russian officials were discussing contacts with Trump associates, and European allies were starting to pass along information about people close to Mr. Trump meeting with Russians in the Netherlands, Britain and other countries.."

"Trump associates" and "people close to Mr. Trump"

And their names are..?

Dear GOP,

Not demanding Trump's tax returns during the primary will be considered the worst mistake you ever made for your party and the country. The NYC banks that fund just about everyone that breathes and can pay have refused to lend money to Trump for decades. Trump lives in the dark world of money laundering and we don't know what. The GOP has just approved Wilbur Ross, the co-chair of the Bank of Cyprus, to be Sec'y of Commerce. The Bank of Cyprus is Putin's money laundering portal.

The longer you work as Trump and Putin's portal to power the harder and longer you will fall. The truth is coming.

Let's face it, Republicans, you backed and are still supporting a dark dirty horse as our "commander in chief".

You were so ecstatic that Trump somehow pulled off an electoral victory that you now APPEAR completely unwilling to do even half of what you did to Hillary Clinton, who, after many investigations, was found to be innocent of what you hoped to hang her for.

All this stuff and all these details and more will be written into books which will be read for years and years. What will your children and grandchildren attending their High Schools and Colleges, who require these books to be read, think?

Republican Congress People, are you Trump At All Cost people or are you American public servants?

But now here we are. And these flabbergasting facts that appear to need serious investigation will try to be swept under the rug by every level of the current regime in charge at the federal, state and local levels. This administration continues to try to fire those who aren't loyalists, to block the intelligence departments from getting to the truth and to smear the media seeking facts. No fictional book or movie could imagine the possibilities this has wrought. It also proves in blazing technicolor that the outrage over Benghazi and emails was completely the fakest of all because nothing is more serious than this yet Rs continue to seek, at most, their own investigation behind closed doors.
Though Palin was exaggerating, seems the Trump Administration can see Russia from the WHouse.

When you have an Oscar award winning performance by Trump, you do have to give him credit for one thing: His "Art of the Distraction." Let's all pretend we don't know "why" he suddenly went "presidential."

Oh puhlease! When the evidence against a guy is such that at any minute the fragility of his status can come crashing down on his head, he would pull out the "Mr. Charm" card to distract the most gullible from his guilt.

Guilty men can be so charming butter wouldn't melt in their mouths when its suits the need. And right now, the Svengali charm is all Trump has left.

It makes sense now "why" the Obama Administration withheld the evidence of the Russian hacking. If they had disclosed it, the Republicans would have had a feast calling it "political partisan influence." Ironic as that may be.

The irony is that while President Obama was trying to contain the damages that it might cause Trump's campaign, it also helped Trump win the election in hindsight and allowed the Republicans to get away with ignoring Russians hacking into our election. That WAS the Republicans WMD. They knew if they said nothing and Obama couldn't, they had Trump in the White House without a doubt.

Games, games, games. It also shows all of us why Comey soft sold the information about the Russian hacking and heavy handed the emails that sank Hillary's election.

Absolution from this comes down to men who know want to say, "Okay. So the Russians hacked an election. Let's move on." Typical.

The obstructions that Obama cleverly moved to prevent happening is horrific. And it is reminiscent of Nixon's equally dangerous abortive destruction of 18 minutes of tapes made in the Oval Office -- these come back to haunt anti-democratic officials in democracies - thank heaven. The NYT and WPost are uniting to seek what every anti-democrat fears most - people discovering the truth.
You go, guys. We have your back.

How do know that Hillary was not involved with the Chinese since we can throw out all these charges without any proof. Back in the 90's the Chinese and Bill Clinton were buddy - buddies so why not conclude that the Chinese were in bed with the Clintons which is as much a possiblity as Trump was with the Russians

Listening to the radio news this morning I'm struck by the commentary about AG Sessions obvious perjury. Saying now that he never discussed the election in multiple meetings with the Russian is saying that he would not have perjured himself had he been asked a different question. He was not asked a different question. Take him out in handcuffs today.

For Republicans this is clear evidence of their perverse "party before country" position.

They see only a need to hang onto as much power as possible to drive as much of the Dark Money agenda as possible. They are beholden to their donor class, and are working against the majority of America's interests.

They will use Trump until he is no longer necessary. Their perversion of Democracy is sickening.

The GOP is morally and ideologically warped and almost wholly unAmerican. Soulless and godless power mongers.

My god.

Are they any people in the Trump administration that can tell the truth?  Soon we will be known as the United States of Liars.  I believe that Trump has discredited the media and the intelligence agencies, because they will find out the truth.  The Trump supporters have to be pretty gullible to believe that he will make America great again, so he assumes they are gullible enough to believe the new is fake.

I can't wait to read Obama's book. He deserves the $60M. This man saved us all from the 2008 crisis and now is still protecting us. While all of us gained monies in our 401ks during his administration, Obama saw none of these gains as he followed the ethics rules and cashed out all of his funds into US bonds. Trump has sold nothing and gains from his lies.

We all miss you so much President Obama.

replies.commentBody: There aren't any elves or any story except a made up one but you believe in actual elves so fake news is as good as any. Apologies to actual normal people that aren't gullible cretins.

comments.commentBody: Sessions: a malignant elf.  Apologies to actual elves.
